fr.apteryx.imageio.dicom
Interface StorageCommitmentRequestListener

public interface StorageCommitmentRequestListener

Interface for listeners of incoming storage commitment requests. When a StorageCommitmentRequestListener has been specified in the constructor of a StorageCommitmentSCP, the SCP calls the requestReceived method of the listener when a request is received. The code of the listener must first determine if the SCP accepts to process the request, so that an appropriate response is sent to the SCU. This response does not imply that the SCP commits to safekeep the SOP instances referenced in the request. If the request is accepted, the SCP must afterwards call the commit method of the StorageCommitmentSCP.Request instance passed to the listener for each SOP instance it commits to safekeep, and the cannotCommit method for the others. When the request has been fully processed, the sendResult must be called.

commit, cannotCommit and sendResult can be called from the requestReceived listener or later from another thread.

See Also:
StorageCommitmentSCP

Method Summary
 void requestReceived(StorageCommitmentSCP.Request request, DataSet response)
          Called when an request is received.
 

Method Detail

requestReceived

void requestReceived(StorageCommitmentSCP.Request request,
                     DataSet response)
Called when an request is received. response is a set of data elements that will be sent in the response message. The response is sent either when this method returns, or when the sendResult method is called if it is called from this method. response contains the Tag.status element with a default value of 0 (meaning success) and may be changed in requestReceived. Typical other values are 0x122 (SOP class not supported), 0x112 (No such object instance) or 0x213 (Resource limitation). Other elements can be added to the data set, like Tag.ErrorComment or Tag.AffectedSOPInstanceUID. See annex C of PS 3.7 in the DICOM standard for possible values for the status codes and additional elements.

If the status code is left its 0 value, methods commit and cannotCommit must be called on request, either from this method or later from another thread.
